titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
The Ms. contains the following text: I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 3ra-173ra) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-5ra) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 5ra-7va) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 7va-14ra) I-4) Monday (fols. 14ra-31ra) - Night hours (fols. 14ra-16va) - Day hours (fols. 16va-31ra) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 31ra-47va) - Night hours (fols. 31ra-38rb) - Day hours (fols. 38rb-48va) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 48va-62va) - Night hours (fols. 48va-50vb) - Day hours (fols. 50vb-62va) I-7) Thursday (fols. 62va-83rb) - Night hours (fols. 61va-64ra) - Day hours (fols. 64ra-83rb) I-8) Friday (fols. 83rb-163rb) - Night hours (fols. 83rb-99vb) - Day hours (fols. 99vb-163rb), including: Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 146v-149r);´Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John” (fols. 151ra-162vb) I-9) Saturday (fols. 163rb-176ra) - Night hours (fols. 163rb-174ra), including: Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 174rb-175vb) I-10) Homilies on Passion of Christ (fols. 176ra-204r) - Homily by Ephrem on Satan and on the death (fols. 176ra-179rb) - Homily by Ephrem on Passion of Our Lord and on the thief on the right hand (fols. 179rb-181va) - Homily by Jaqob of Serug on the angel and the thief (fols. 181va-186vb) - Homily by ʾAnǝsṭasyos of Däbrä Sina on the burial of Our Lord (fols. 186vb-191va) - Homily by John Chrysostom on the Passion of Our Lord (fols. 191va-194rb) I-11) Mäṣḥafä dorho “Book of the Cock” ( (fols. 194rb-204r)
Additiones 1-2.

txstates.txstate: Cuts repaired on fols. 45, 48, 91, 108, 157, 184. Fols. 141, 157, 163, 193 are cut at the bottom edge. Fols. 110, 113 are cut at the bottom corner.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations. Two pairs of chains of endbands stitches through the spine cover.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover and turn-ins (at least 5 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, double crescent, cross hatching, double sine wave with dots).

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – ፫III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – ፭V(8/fols. 35r-43v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 44r-51v) – ፯VII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/ fols. 52r-59v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 60r-67v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 68r-75v) – ፲X(8; s.l.; 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 76r-83v) – ፲፩XI(8/flos. 84r-91v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 92r-100v) – ፲፫XIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 101r-107v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 108r- 115v) – ፲፭XV(8/fols. 116r-123v) – ፲፮XVI(8/fols. 124r-131v) – ፲፯XVII(8/fols. 132r-139v) – ፲፰XVIII(8/fols. 140r-147v) – ፲፱XIX(8/fols. 148r-155v) – ፳XX(9: s.l.: 5, stub after 4/fols. 156r-164v) – ፳፩XXI(8/fols. 165r-172v) – ፳፪XXII(8/fols. 173r-180v) – XXIII(8/fols. 181r-188v) – XXIV(8/fols. 189r-196v) – XXV(8/fols. 197r-204v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by letters of small size; the width of the letters is larger than their height.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; a few lines are rubricated alternating with black lines on fol. 3r; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers or their abbreviations; names of Hebrew letters on fols. 128r-129v (Lam. 3); the words ḫaylǝyä (Text I-3), nastäbäqqwǝʿakä or its abbreviation (Text I-7), mǝʿǝraf (fol. 113ra, Text I-8), qädami (fol. 123va, Text I-8), ṣällǝyu (Text I-8), ʾǝgziʾo täśähalännä (fol. 175vb, Text I-9), several words in “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text I-9); quire mark on fol. 2r or elements of it on fol. 173v; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ይካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ናስ፡ for ናስተበቊዕከ፡ (Text I-7) ሰ፡ ለ፡/ሰ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ (ቅድስት፡ ?) (Additio 1) አ፡ for አወ፡ (Additio 2) አ፡ ወወ፡ ወ፡ for አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅድስ፡ (Additio 2)

additional.cont: Fol. 2r: Unidentified säläm-hymn for St. Mary (?).
additional.add: Fol. 2r: ርግብ፡ ሰላማዊት፡ ወንጽር፡ መንፈስዊት፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ በሥምረተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ እምትካት፡ የኀረየኪ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ በኵሉ፡ ጊዜ፡ ጽልዮተኪ፡ በጽሐ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይሙት፡ ገብርኪ፡…
additional.det: Written by the same hand as that of Additio 2 (same as that of the main text?), in one column.

additional.add: Fol. 204v: ኦእግዚእየ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልድ፡ ዋህድ፡ ቃለ፡ እግዚአብሔር። አብ፡ ዘበተከ፡ እምኔነ፡ ኵሎ፡ ማዕሠ(ረ)፡ ኃጣውኢነ፡ በሕማማቲከ፡ መኅየዊት፡ ወመድኀኒት፡ ዘነፋሕከ፡ ላዕለ፡ ገጸ፡ አርዳኢከ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ወላዕከኒከ፡ ንጹሐን፡ ወትቤሎሙ፡ ንሥኡ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሰእለ፡ ኃደግሙ፡ ለሰብእ፡ ኀጢአተ።…
additional.det: Note on how Jesus broke the bounds of sins by means of His Passion, and how He blew upon the apostles and ministers faces the Holy Spirit, in order to redeem mankind from sins. The same hand as that of Additio 1 (the same as that of the main text?).

extras.extra: - Excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (?) added in the upper margins of fols. 122v, 123r, 123v, 127v, 128r. - Crude notes written in blue, red pen and pencil on fols 4r, 33v, 34v, 51r, 52r, 53v, 55v, 103, 148v, 154v, 171v, 173v. - The words ʾǝläf kämäḉärräšaw are written, framed by dots, in the margin between columns on fol. 13r. - Numbers (?) are added between columns on fols 37v, 44r, 49v and in the left margin of fol. 76r. - Tämälläs-signs (in the shape of +) indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margin, or interlineally, belong: fols. 28r, 33r. - Immediate corrections marked by thin lines below words (e.g. fols. 32ra, 54va, 63vb, 84va, 113vb) and by thin lines above (fol. 128vb). - Omissions or corrections are written interlineally, e.g., fols. 13va, 13vb, 20ra, 48ra, 68vb, 80ra, 106rb, 132vb. - Unfilled spaces left for rubrication on fols. 2r (Additio 1), 203va, 204rb, 204v (Additio 2). - Lacuna in fol. 72rb: the text interrupts on fol. 72ra and resumes on fol. 72va. - The scribe reduced the size of the script on fols. 161vb-162rb.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks on fols. 3r, 11r, 17r, 27r, 35r, 44r, 52r; decorated quire marks on fols. 60r, 68r, 76r, 84r, 92r, 100r, 108r, 116r, 124r, 132r, 140r, 148r, 156r, 165r, 173r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - A strip of textile (for navigating in the text?) is inserted on fol. 82r. - Thread for navigating in the text on fols. 12r, 33 (?). - A thread (for navigating in the text?) is inserted within the parchment´s hole in the bottom corner of fol. 74.

miniature.info: Fol. 1v: St. George slaying the dragon.
